issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: when moving app, activeUsers is increased, even though app does not have outstanding request

comments.body:
This change makes sense. Could you please add unit test to validate this and to verify the patch fixes it.

3 cases to look here
 # Active user count has to decrease from old queue
 # Increase the active user count in target queue if the moved app has pending requests 
 # Active user count in target queue stays same if the moved app has NO pending requests
cc [~manirajv06@gmail.com] who was also mentioning this issue in another ticket.
attaches a patch including test case. and it is based on up-to-date trunk.

[~kyungwan nam], Thank you for providing the fix for this problem. The fix looks good and the unit test is doing a good job of testing what I would expect it to test. The failed unit tests in the latest pre-commit build ({{TestAMRestart}} / {{TestQueueManagementDynamicEditPolicy}}) are not failing for me in my local build environment.

The only minor problem with the latest patch is that the parameters to the assertions in the test are backwards. That is, the "expected" value should come first and the "actual" value should come second.

[~eepayne], Thank you for your review.
I've attached a new patch according to your comment.

+1
If this is a problem in 2.8, I would like to see these changes backported all the way back.

I've attached a patch for branch-2.8
Thanks [~eepayne], [~sunilg]
